ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates the basics of the UniformGridDataSeries3D and SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D types in SciChart
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates the basics of the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.UniformGridDataSeries3D%603.html']UniformGridDataSeries3D[/url] and [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20SurfaceMesh%203D%20Chart%20Type.html']SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D[/url].
This versatile type allows rendering of 3D surfaces / terrain / grids / spectrogram and heatmaps which could be used for visualizing Topology data, Statistical analysis, Volatility Smiles etc...
The Surface Mesh colors and palette can be updated by supplying a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.RenderableSeries.MeshColorPalette.html']MeshColorPalette[/url], which wraps a LinearGradientBrush, or a Texture. The [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20SurfaceMesh%203D%20Chart%20Type.html']SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D[/url] allows various paletting options and rendering options, such as Wireframe, Solid Mesh, Solid Cells Height-map, Interpolated Height-map and plain texturing.
